bibl.title: Certification of Hospital Admission for John J. Moran, May 30, 1901

div1.p: Ames certifies that Moran was diagnosed with yellow fever and was admitted to the Post Hospital on December 25, 1900 and was discharged on January 7, 1901. Members of the Yellow Fever Board also signed the certificate.

div1.head: Certification of Hospital Admission for John J. Moran, May 30, 1901
div1.p:
I CERTIFY that John J. Moran, Civilian Employee,
U. S. A., whose signature appears below, was admitted to this Hospital
on the 25" day of Dec, 1900, and was discharged on the 7" day
of Jany, 190/. Diagnosis: Yellow Fever.

Roger Post Ames,
Captain, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Vols.,
Attending Surgeon.

John J. Moran
Signature of Patient.

We, the undersigned, members of the Yellow Fever Board of the City of
Havana, do concur in the above diagnosis.

Dr. A.D. Albertini M. D.
Member.

W.C. Gorgas,
Major, Surgeon, U. S. A.,
Chief Sanitary Officer,
City of Havana.
